laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count: 8200 per cubic millimeter (85% neutrophils, 10% lymphocytes, 5% monocytes); Hemoglobin level: 9.7 g/dL; Hematocrit: 29.3%; Mean corpuscular volume: 81 μm3; Platelet count: 333,000 per cubic millimeter.
Normal except for serum albumin level of 2.2 g/dL.
3+ protein and 2 to 5 red cells per high-power field; urine sediment showed red-cell casts; 24-hour urine collection revealed 7.6 g of protein.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Urinary protein excretion less than 500 mg in 24 hours post-treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Titer greater than 1:640 with a diffuse pattern.
Initial: complex mass encasing the mitral valve; mean diastolic mitral gradient of 16 mm Hg. Follow-up: reduction in mass size; mean diastolic gradient decreased to 6.9 mm Hg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked reduction in mass size over 11 months.
